content: hide the extra yarn 3 sew the edges of all the leg openings together in a similar manner to the ears sew the bottom two legs along the 5th row of the body close but not touching the white part tie off and hide the extra yarn 4 sew the arms onto the body around 3 row down from the top on either side overlapping the white part a bit tie off and hide the extra yarn ©2023aybeecreates lankyfoxcrochetpattern 5 sew the tail on around the 3rd-5th row of the body centered on the backside sew around at least twice making sure it s extra secure since the weight of the tail will test that join tie off and hide the extra yarn 6 for the eyes start with a length of black yarn and tie a knot on one end enter through the body and work your way to the side of the head make a + shape with four stitches going into the same center the size and position of the + will determine the size and placement of the eye once you have the + start going in a spiral underneath the black stitches until you have a full black circle repeat for the other side 7 using the same black yarn from the eyes if you ever run out just take another length of black and continue where you left off start the nose by going through the sides of the ©2023aybeecreates lankyfoxcrochetpattern magic_ring at the end of the nose repeat the same stitch 3-4 times until desired width of the nose is reached for the bottom part of the nose start a ¼ or so beneath the nose just into the white part and loop the yarn over then under the center of the top part of the nose repeat 2-3 times to make a rough triangle shape 8 make the smile as pictured the smile ending no further than the center of the eye the mouth can either be connected to the nose for a more natural look or left separate to be more cutesy i connected the mouth secure and hide the excess black yarn 9 start a length of white yarn by tying a knot on one end and running through the body to the head start in the center of the eye and make one stitch running from the center to the top back corner repeat on the other side secure yarn and hide the excess ©2023aybeecreates lankyfoxcrochetpattern your lanky fox is all done i hope you enjoyed crocheting it and found the pattern helpful i would love to see your finished project so share a picture on social media with me by tagging me @aybeecreates once again if you have any questions don t hesitate to reach out to me through email at aybeecreates@gmail com happy crocheting ©2023aybeecreates
